result.execSummary:
The defendant William W Winkelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:21 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant William W Winkelman in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer submits criminal case settlement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Arguments by Counsel; Statement by Catherine R. Henson

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 4 years, with conditions:
--serve 120 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence concurrent to any other sentence in being
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Random urinalyses at least 1x/month for the 1st 12 months
--Absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay restitution of $1684.98 payable to Michael & Catherine Henson
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay costs of $268

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 1:56 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:38 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William W Winkelman in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer submits plea questionnaire/waiver of rights
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that a waiver of preliminary hearing has not been conducted
off-record: 1:39 - 1:41 pm for Atty Fischer to complete WOPH paperwork
ADA Beck informs the Court that the victim was informed of today's hearing, but only as a STC and not a plea
Court informs parties that It will take waiver of preliminary hearing today, but can not take pleas as there is not victim rights

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Winkelman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 8/21/14 at 1:15 pm (15 minutes) - Send notices
Scheduling Notice
Status conference on August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 10:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William W Winkelman in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer: Already had PTC, learned some information regarding current probation & have been exchanging offers with ADA Teuber. Confident will be able to resolve, but not there yet. Client is serving ATR now and hope that jail imposed will run concurrent. Requests additional STC date.
ADA Shock: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Winkelman that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT:  Notices Given in Court - Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
original bond document received from JESO 8/5/14
Defendant's (with cover letter)
Attorny Joseph Fischer (with cover letter)
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Status conference on August 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Scheduling notice
Conflict review worksheet
Probable Cause statement
SPD appeared for bail purposes only

Case called at 2:17 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant William W Winkelman appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek indicates that it is the SPDs understanding that Attorney Joseph Fischer will represent Mr. Winkelman so financial evaluation has not been completed and SPD appears for bond purpsoes only
Court reviews off-the-record discussion with Atty Flint re: State did receive information that Atty Fischer will be Atty of record
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; no conflict found - Court endorses review sheet

Service of Complaint admitted; Court confirms address & DOB are accurate as listed on complaint; charges/penalties reicted; reading waived
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-No contact with Michael or Cathy Hensen
-No presence at the Market Street Inn

Mr. Winkelman confirms for the Court that Atty Fischer will be representing him in this matter
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Recess: 2:27 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/23/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 8/8/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
